total_impedance_ori_txt: R12 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R12*Rd/(R12+Rd)=1 Ohm
Rc and R10 connected in series so Rb=Rc+R10=2 Ohm
R9 and Ri connected in parallel so Rh=R9*Ri/(R9+Ri)=1 Ohm
Rh and R7 connected in series so Rg=Rh+R7=2 Ohm
R4 and R5 connected in series so Rk=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R2 and Ro connected in parallel so Rn=R2*Ro/(R2+Ro)=1 Ohm
Rn and R3 connected in series so Rm=Rn+R3=2 Ohm
Rk and Rm connected in parallel so Rj=Rk*Rm/(Rk+Rm)=1 Ohm
Rg and Rj connected in series so Rf=Rg+Rj=3 Ohm
Rf and R6 connected in series so Re=Rf+R6=4 Ohm
Rb and Re connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Re/(Rb+Re)=1.33 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1.33 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R12 and R11 connected in parallel so Rc=R12*R11/(R12+R11)=1 Ohm
Rc and R10 connected in series so Rb=Rc+R10=2 Ohm
R9 and R8 connected in parallel so Rh=R9*R8/(R9+R8)=1 Ohm
Rh and R7 connected in series so Rg=Rh+R7=2 Ohm
R4 and R5 connected in series so Rk=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R2 and R1 connected in parallel so Rn=R2*R1/(R2+R1)=1 Ohm
Rn and R3 connected in series so Rm=Rn+R3=2 Ohm
Rk and Rm connected in parallel so Rj=Rk*Rm/(Rk+Rm)=1 Ohm
Rg and Rj connected in series so Rf=Rg+Rj=3 Ohm
Rf and R6 connected in series so Re=Rf+R6=4 Ohm
Rb and Re connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Re/(Rb+Re)=1.33 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1.33 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R1?

solution: This is a DC calculation
At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R12 and R11 connected in parallel so Rc=R12*R11/(R12+R11)=1 Ohm
Rc and R10 connected in series so Rb=Rc+R10=2 Ohm
R9 and R8 connected in parallel so Rh=R9*R8/(R9+R8)=1 Ohm
Rh and R7 connected in series so Rg=Rh+R7=2 Ohm
R4 and R5 connected in series so Rk=R4+R5=2 Ohm
R2 and R1 connected in parallel so Rn=R2*R1/(R2+R1)=1 Ohm
Rn and R3 connected in series so Rm=Rn+R3=2 Ohm
Rk and Rm connected in parallel so Rj=Rk*Rm/(Rk+Rm)=1 Ohm
Rg and Rj connected in series so Rf=Rg+Rj=3 Ohm
Rf and R6 connected in series so Re=Rf+R6=4 Ohm
Rb and Re connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Re/(Rb+Re)=1.33 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1.33 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 5 V.
(1) The components Rb,Re connected in parallel. The voltage on Re is 5 V because the voltage on Ra is 5 V
(2) The components Rf,R6 connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 5 V.
(2) Rf is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rf is Rf/Re*5 V = 3.75 V.
(3) The components Rg,Rj connected in series.
(3) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 3.75 V.
(3) Rj is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rj is Rj/Rf*3.75 V = 1.25 V.
(4) The components Rk,Rm connected in parallel. The voltage on Rm is 1.25 V because the voltage on Rj is 1.25 V
(5) The components Rn,R3 connected in series.
(5) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 1.25 V.
(5) Rn is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rn is Rn/Rm*1.25 V = 0.62 V.
(6) The components R2,R1 connected in parallel. The voltage on R1 is 0.62 V because the voltage on Rn is 0.62 V
